column2: The Cadaver Synod

You have received strange news from Manila. The former Primate, [From.GetTitledFirstName], did by his actions and lifestyle so defile the Conferantia that the current authorities have decided to put his corpse on trial!\nThe corpse of [From.GetTitledFirstName] was removed from its tomb and brought to the interim court for legation and affairs. It was propped up on a throne, and a deacon was chosen to speak for it as its legal representative.\nThe accused was found guilty on all accounts and subjected to a punishment most dire. The corpse was stripped of thier vestments, three fingers on the right hand (those used to give blessings) were cut off, and then it was interred in a graveyard normally reserved for foreigners of low status. The punishment still not being deemed severe enough, the corpse was then exhumed again, tied to weights and cast into the ocean.
The Red Death sweeps across the Asia as regional strife subsides as the Orient sets its views beyond its shore...
The Red Death will appear at the very earliest in the year 2700, and 100 years after the game has started. After one major outbreak the epidemic will become endemic.
The Red Death will appear at the very earliest 200 years after the game has started, and might reappear 400 years after game start. After one major outbreak the epidemic will become endemic.
The Red Death will appear in the year 2915 and follow its "historical" route.
The Red Death will appear frequently and be extraordinarily deadly. §RWARNING: This setting is not recommended for a normal game!§!
[From.GetTitledName] is worried you may be infected with the Red Death. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] is worried you may be infected with the Red Death and you mare may not recover. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.

[From.GetTitledName] states that [From.GetHerHis] extensive medical experience leads [From.GetHerHim] to the certain conclusion that you are infected with the Red Death, also known as Thrax. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] is worried you are infected with the Red Death, also know as Thrax. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] hesitantly suggests you are probably infected with the Red Death. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
Red Death
The Red Death
of the dreaded Thrax
This character has the dreaded Red Death.
The Red Rider has brought the Red Death to this county.
A Horrible Affliction

Our people in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName] are suffering from a frightening epidemic. Those afflicted by the disease experience piercing pain and violent madness, and bleed profusely from all of their orifices as well as from gaping skin lesions. Death comes quickly thereafter, even to victims healthy only a few days earlier. Dread is spreading, seeping into the heart of the realm while our healers are at a loss — there is no cure to the horror wreaking havoc among the populace. The cause of the disease is unknown and those trying to protect themselves are left to their own devices. Bodies are piling up, riddled with bloody lesions... The Red Death is at our doorstep.
Word of an Epidemic

We have received news of an epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. The information is vague, but word is people are dying like flies and the fear of the disease is spreading as fast as the affliction itself. Furthermore, the condition is reported irreversible as well as incurable, and the scattered records of the events are worrisome. With no source of evil revealed people are turning to their gods and on each other, to protect themselves from contagion. Many call it a new plague.

We have received news of a horrible epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName], part of [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. At first the rumors were thought to be exaggerated, but ever since the disorderly arrival of inconsolable refugees at our gates, it has been difficult to ignore what is happening. They tell of various symptoms, and our couriers from the area report seeing bloody lesions, people vomiting blood before dying, while others are driven into a mad frenzy... biting their caretakers as they froth at the mouth. Terror is spreading as rapidly as the disease and so far there has been no mention of a cure... Only mass graves. Is this the will of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]?
The Plague Approaches

Mobs of new people are arriving in [bordering_province.GetName]. Most of the newly arrived are commoners fleeing the plague that has reached [infected_province.GetName] just beyond the borders of our realm. Some have lost their whole families, some are trying to protect theirs and a few are travelers or merchants that had an easier time moving. All of them seem to have witnessed indescribable horrors, hardly any will talk about it at all. The ones that do talk, warn others of the coming plague and urge them stay inside or pack their things and flee.
Nusantara Ravaged by Plague
When will it end?
Indochina Ravaged by Plague
Japan Ravaged by Plague
China Ravaged by Plague
Tibet Ravaged by Plague
The Philippines Ravaged by Plague
Korea Ravaged by Plague
Russia Ravaged by Plague
Papua Ravaged by Plague
Mongolia Ravaged by Plague

Across Nusantara, the Red Death arrives by ship and is spread further by pirate raiders taking advantage of the chaos. There are rumors of islands isolated enough to be untouched by the outbreak, but they are few and far between. To further disturb the people a story is circulating — survivors speak of a cursed ship, carrying living corpses come to recruit for their captain of death...

Thrax has spread reached Indochina, from the once bustling cities of the coast to even in the deep jungles and hills. While the people sought refuge in the temples and mosques at first, now they too lay deserted, only corpses bowing before the gods as funerary pyres choke the air full of suffering. Bodies bloated beyond recognition float down the Mekong and strewn across the streets and villages from Hanoi to Bangkok.

Across Japan, the Red Death arrives by ship at the many ports but as in other areas the death shook society to its core. There are rumors of the Imperial Family secluding themselves in the hallowed Palace of Kyoto enough to be untouched by the outbreak, but in truth even in Kyoto, funerary pyres can be seen burning from the temple of the Kami. As plague ravages the populace, more and more bodies are left unattended by the stained red robes of the Kannushi who to have succumbed to the Thrax.

Death is stalking the Middle Kingdom as Thrax spreads amongst the great cities and vast imperial realms of China. Lesion-riddled bodies lay rotting in the sun and the stench is unbearable. Many have fled the large cities hoping to find refugee in ancestral villages but the epidemic follows with the bodies floating down the Yangtze and Huang He.

The Red Death has spread high into the Tibetan Plateau and the once mighty Himalayas, and across the searing deserts of the Gobi. The few surviving stragglers from these secluded mountain monasteries speak of only one thing: death.

Death comes to all, and across The Philippines the terror is becoming mundane. From Luzon to the Mindanao, nobles and peasants alike crowd the churches praying for forgiveness and mercy. The road from Manila to Davao is reportedly littered with miles of bloody corpses. Travels to the area are currently discouraged.

When Thrax first spread through peaks of Mt.Paektu, many sought refuge in the shrines of heros. Now temple steps across the region are stained red with the blood of the dead, and monks are tasked with burning their bodies even if it means they too succumb.

The icy northern realms of Russia were thought to be safe from the Red Death... but death comes to all men, no matter their rank or where they live. The countryside of the afflicted areas have been left haunting and desolate.

An ominous shadow surrounds the Island of Papua as Thrax has left little but tragedy in its wake. Along the coasts, pyres from the burning of the diseased can be seen from miles away. Despite the heavy quarantine in the harbors, numerous ghost ships have been spotted eerily drifting across the great blue that surrounds the island.

No one is safe as the Red Death tears through Mongolia. The yurts of many communities lay deserted as their inhabitants have fled in fear. The tribes are riding into the wilderness, desperately trying to escape the epidemic. Trails of bloody bodies mark their passing.

column2: There are many legendary figures in the [Root.Religion.GetName] pantheon, but it would be only right to dedicate such an important temple as [scoped_temple_barony.GetName] to one of the greatest warriors of the sea, or to the Queen of the Oceans herself.
This temple belongs to Gadao.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to §YGadao§!, The Greatest Warrior by Providence.
Let Perry consecrate this temple!
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to §YPerry§!, the Deal-Maker.
This is the home of Roosevelt.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to Couragous §YRoosevelt§!, the World-Surfer.
Latmikaik will inhabit this temple.
Dedicate the temple of §Y[scoped_temple_barony.GetName]§! to the Sea Mother §YLatmikaik§!, Queen of the Oceans.

Gadao has always held a prominent place in Americanist folk tradition. He is credited with bringing the sun to earth, and it is commonly held that he will be the first to arrive should the white canoes return
This shall be Gadao's temple!

Perry is one of the greatest explorers. It is said he set sail in a special black canoe, with the white fleet following him, for forty and forty days and nights, and opened trade with distant islands across the ocean.
This shall be Perry's temple!

Roosevelt is the leader of all the white fleet. Though a fearless and peerless warrior, he has spent so long rowing that he can no longer rise from his canoe to step on shore. Nevertheless, he remains a popular figure for his unfailing spirit and determination.
This shall be Roosevelt's temple!
The Queen of the Oceans, Latmikaik's worship has since spread out of her native Palau, and now she is widely known as the grandmother of humanity.
This shall be the Sea Queen's temple!

With the temple finished, you and your priest arrive on the temple grounds for one final rite of passage in devotion to the sea gods. Your Priest hands you a translucent shell filled with aged fruit cocktail, preparing for an ancient tradition for new ships brought to the temples to honor the sea gods. You lift the shell high above your head and with all your spirit you toss the shell against the wall, the shattering being a metaphorical representation of the many islands of the Great Sea.
Praise be Old Providence of the Sea!
§GCan declare county conquest wars on any coastal counties§!

You meet with your vassals and [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s court official in the middle of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]'s square.\nAddressing the crowd of commoners gathered all around you, you publicly declare the barbarian ways and an adoption of a just and righteous administration, gesturing for your vassals to do the same. A few murmurs rise from the crowd, but they are swiftly quelled. Then, as the court official set forth the declaration of new governance, you declare your loyalty to the traditions of your people and your ancestors.\nYou all turn towards the imperial regalia brought by court official, bow gracefully before the crowd and ancestors, and renew the Mandate of Heaven.

The hooded priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, but the ceremony begins only after sunset, once they have helped the icons of the new gods adjust to their new home in your temple.\nYou meet with your vassals outside the city, a crowd of your subjects assembling all around you, and then, under the cheers of flowers and booze, the Americanist priests begin the rite. They paint your faces with symbols of liberty and freedom, burn sacred herbs and chant their ancient rites, as you all enter an ecstatic dance.\nMerriment and cheers follow through the night as you declare yourself to the Sea Gods. When you wake at dawn of the next day, the priests are already gone. Little by little, the merry crowd of converts returns to [converting_king.Capital.GetName].

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] arrive at dawn, carrying strange metal instruments and artifacts. When the time comes they lead you and your vassals to an old, rusted temple near [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting nearby. \nThe priests instruct you to wait and quickly enter the temple. After what feels like hours, the temple, miraculously, lights up, dazzling lights briefly flicker. You and your vassals proclaim on the spot that your old gods are dead, and swear an oath of loyalty to the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The priests lead the crowd into the temple grounds and instruct them in the rituals required to operate it, enduring until the sun begins to set and the temple grounds finally shuts down. When the day is over, they proclaim that you are now workers for the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName].

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your vassals at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of your subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by proclaiming that, contrary to what many of your subjects have believed, they may continue worshiping their ancient ways, as long as they swear an oath of allegiance to the Empire. They then begin reciting ancient Quinto passages, instructing you and your followers on the ancient rights and obligations of a proper subject. When the last rays of sun reappear in the distance, you and your vassals swear a final oath, and become true Believer of the Empire.

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Apostle leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets you at a river near the city. Your faithful vassals stand beside you, while the rest of your subjects wait their turn behind them, looking still visibly merry. The Apostle recites a few verses from [mormon.GetScriptureName] before you lead your vassals into the river. As you pass the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests they baptize you, one after the other, in the cold water. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides" the Apostle proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests arrive at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] with a luxurious parade, carrying the tall, golden idol to The Golden Lord to the center of your capital. \nYou meet them with your vassals, surrounded by a crowd of commoners, and publicly renounce your old gods before bowing to the golden idol. \nOne by one, you order your offerings of gold and precious stones to be delivered unto the new god, covering his idol little by little with increasingly more opulent garments. After you and your vassals have finished with your donations, some of the people from the crowd join in as well, leaving what little they have at the feet of the idol as it is carried inside its new home.

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] chroniclers arrive a few days before the ceremony in order to settle in their new temple.\nFor all the remaining days before the event, you and your vassals find yourself stuck listening to an endless list of rules and rituals that the priests swear you must absolutely know in order to correctly worship [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName] without suffering any ill effects. When the day for the mass conversion comes, the ceremony itself looks almost like an afterthought in comparison to the bureaucratic preparation. The chroniclers quickly cleanse all old icons publicly and allow you to renounce your old gods before hiding back inside the temple and resuming their private rituals.

Although the Ancestors built their nation from war, it is a commendable feat for you to have converted an entire score of barbarians through words only. \nYou have no doubts that those that transgress still hide in [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s domain, but now that the ruling class has been brought into the heel, it is only a matter of time until everybody else in the realm follows. With the mass conversion of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName], you have helped spread the bureaucratic institutions to uncivilized realms.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your gods and to teach them how to placate the spirits of industry surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the gods according to tradition, lest ill luck befall them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to the Glory of Unsung King and the glories of the Empire. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and follow The Law, lest ill luck befalls them.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to your gods and to teach them how to placate the spirits of the wild surrounding them. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the gods according to tradition, lest ill luck befalls them.

You receive news from your missionaries only a few days after the mass baptism of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]. Although the priest writes that he does not feel entirely convinced about the sincerity of the barbarians' conversion, the ceremony went well and [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is now officially [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nBy aiding in the conversion of an entire score of pagans to the One True Faith, you have accomplished a feat worthy of the Smith himself.

Your priests have done their best to introduce [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s people to Capitalism. \nYou can only hope now that they will stay true to their word and please the Almighty Golden Lord according to tradition, lest ill luck befall them.

Your chroniclers have returned bringing news from [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nThe local tribes have been successfully introduced to the worship of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. \nWith the proper grooming, they will become model followers of the true faith, given enough time.

You meet with your liege and [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s court official in the middle of [converting_king.Capital.GetName]'s square.\nAddressing the crowd of commoners reunited all around you, [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] publicly denounces the barbarian ways and an adoption of a just and righteous administration, gesturing for your and the [converting_king.GetHerHis] vassals to do the same. A few murmurs rise from the crowd, but they are swiftly quelled. Then, as the court official set forth the declaration of new governance, you declare your loyalty to the traditions of your people and your ancestors.\nYou all turn towards the imperial regalia brought by court official, bow gracefully before the crowd and ancestors, and renew the Mandate of Heaven..

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at dawn. When the time comes you meet your liege outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting near a rusted temple. \nThe priests start the ceremony chanting and operating their sacred instruments. Suddenly, the temple lights up, and steam begins pouring from the smokestack. The priests teach you how to maintain the temple grounds, continuing until the temple grounds finally shuts down. When the sun begins to set, they proclaim that you are now workers for the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName].

The priests from [sponsoring_king.Capital.GetName] insist that the ritual be performed at sunset. When the time comes you meet your liege at the top of a cliff outside [converting_king.Capital.GetName], with a crowd of [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects waiting below. \nThe priests start the ceremony by explaining how to follow your "True Will". When the last rays of sun disappear in the distance you all proclaim your allegiance to the Empire. The priests recite ancient Quinto precepts, enduring for the entirety of the night, even after most of the common crowd has fallen asleep. When dawn comes, they proclaim that you are now Believer of the Empire..

The conversion of [converting_king.Capital.GetName] starts on a cold morning.\nThe Apostle leading [sponsoring_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s embassy meets your liege at a river near the city. You stand beside [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName], while [converting_king.GetHerHis] subjects wait their turn behind you, looking still visibly merry. The Apostle recites a few verses from the Book of Mormon, then [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] leads you all in the river while the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests baptize you as you pass by them. It takes some prodding from the guards to convince the peasants to follow you into the water, but, after a while, the entire crowd stands soaked and shaking by the riverside, just in time to watch the priests and their helpers drop your old idols into the waves.\n"As the false visages are swallowed by the tides," the Apostle proclaims, "may their memory forever be banished from your soul."

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priests arrive at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] with a luxurious parade, carrying the tall, golden idol of the Almighty Golden Lord to the center of [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName]'s capital. \nYou meet them with your liege and [converting_king.GetHerHis] other vassals, surrounded by a crowd of commoners, and publicly renounce your old gods before bowing to the golden idol. \nOne by one, [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] orders your offerings of gold and precious stones to be delivered unto the new god, covering his statue little by little with increasingly more opulent garments. After you have all finished with your donations, some of the people from the crowd join in as well, leaving what little they have at the feet of the idol as it is carried inside its new home.

The [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] chroniclers arrive a few days before the ceremony in order to settle in their new temple.\nFor all the remaining days before the event, you and your liege find yourself stuck listening to an endless list of rules and rituals that the chroniclers swear you must absolutely know in order to correctly worship [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetHighGodName] without suffering any ill effects. When the day for the mass conversion comes, the ceremony itself looks almost like an afterthought in comparison to the bureaucratic preparation. The chroniclers quickly cleanse all old icons publicly and allow you to renounce your old gods before hiding back inside the temple and resuming their private rituals.

[converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to destroy the statues of the old gods and convert to Americanism. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been forced to watch their gods be humiliated and destroyed by foreign priests with the approval of their own [converting_king.GetTitle]. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the stars and stripes reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].

[converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to embrace the [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] gods. \nAccording to most accounts, the foreign priests have employed a vile ritual to summon evil spirits to control and twist the minds of your liege and the other converts.\nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before this new religion forces its way to [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour embrasser les dieux [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMascPl].\nSelon les récits de l'événement, les prêtres étrangers ont procédé à un infâme rituel pour faire venir les esprits maléfiques afin de posséder les âmes de votre [Root.Liege.GetLordLady] lige et des autres convertis.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers les ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que cette nouvelle religion s'impose à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um die [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Götter anzunehmen.\nDen meisten Berichten zufolge, haben die ausländischen Priester ein abscheuliches Ritual angewandt, um böse Geister zu beschwören, die die Gedanken Eures Lehnsherrn und der anderen Konvertierten kontrollieren und verdrehen.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis die neue Religion ihren Schatten auch auf [Root.Capital.GetName] wirft.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para adoptar los dioses [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]. \nSegún la mayoría de los relatos, los sacerdotes extranjeros usaron un ritual inmundo para invocar espíritus maligno que controlasen y alterasen las mentes de tu señor y los otro conversos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que esta nueva religión se abra paso en [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to be baptized by a [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priest. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been led like cattle through a river while the blasphemous ceremony took place above them. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the cross reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour être baptisés par un prêtre [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMasc].\nLe peuple autrefois fier [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] a été mené comme du bétail à un fleuve où a eu lieu la cérémonie blasphématoire.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers l'ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que l'ombre de la croix ne plane au-dessus de [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um von einem [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Priester getauft zu werden.\nDas einst stolze Volk von [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] wurde wie Vieh durch einen Fluss geführt, während sie die blasphemische Zeremonie über sich ergehen lassen mussten.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis der Schatten des Kreuzes auch [Root.Capital.GetName] erreicht.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para que los bautice un sacerdote [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nEl pueblo de [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], antes orgulloso, fue conducido a un río como el ganado, mientras una ceremonia blasfema tenía lugar sobre ellos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que la sombra de la cruz llegue a [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to be baptized by a [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName] priest. \nThe once proud people of [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have been led like cattle through a river while the blasphemous ceremony took place above them. \nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before the shadow of the cross reaches [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour être baptisés par un prêtre [sponsoring_king.GetReligionMasc].\nLe peuple autrefois fier [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] a été mené comme du bétail à un fleuve où a eu lieu la cérémonie blasphématoire.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers l'ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que l'ombre de la croix ne plane au-dessus de [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um von einem [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName]en Priester getauft zu werden.\nDas einst stolze Volk von [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName] wurde wie Vieh durch einen Fluss geführt, während sie die blasphemische Zeremonie über sich ergehen lassen mussten.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis der Schatten des Kreuzes auch [Root.Capital.GetName] erreicht.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para que los bautice un sacerdote [sponsoring_king.Religion.GetName].\nEl pueblo de [converting_king.PrimaryTitle.GetName], antes orgulloso, fue conducido a un río como el ganado, mientras una ceremonia blasfema tenía lugar sobre ellos.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que la sombra de la cruz llegue a [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] and all of [converting_king.GetHerHis] spineless new converts have reunited at [converting_king.Capital.GetName] to embrace the sun god. \nAccording to most accounts, the foreign priests have forced all the people reunited for the ceremony to give away all their possessions to the golden statue of their greedy new god in a most humiliating display.\nYou can only imagine what sort of indignities the foreign priests subjected them to, but you are certain that now it is only a matter of time before this new religion forces its way to [Root.Capital.GetName].
column3: [converting_king.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] et tous ses nouveaux convertis sans convictions se sont réunis à [converting_king.Capital.GetName] pour embrasser le dieu du soleil.\nSelon les récits de l'événement, les prêtres étrangers ont obligé les gens présents à laisser tous leurs biens à la statue en or de leur nouveau dieu cupide. Un spectacle des plus humiliants.\nVous pouvez seulement imaginer à quel genre d'indignités les prêtres étrangers les ont soumis, mais vous êtes certain que ce n'est plus qu'une question de temps avant que cette nouvelle religion s'impose à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column4: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] und alle [converting_king.GetHerHis]er rückgratlosen neuen Konvertierten haben sich in [converting_king.Capital.GetName] getroffen, um dem Sonnengott zu huldigen.\nDen meisten Berichten zufolge, haben die ausländischen Priester alle, die sich für die Zeremonie gesammelt haben, dazu gezwungen, ihre Besitztümer der goldenen Statue ihres gierigen neuen Gotten in einer demütigen Zurschaustellung zu übergeben.\nIhr könnt Euch nur vorstellen, welche Art der Demütigungen die ausländischen Priester ihnen zufügten, aber Ihr seid sicher, dass es nur eine Frage der Zeit ist, bis die neue Religion ihren Schatten auch auf [Root.Capital.GetName] wirft.
column6: [converting_king.GetTitledFirstName] y todos sus nuevos conversos sin agallas se reunieron en [converting_king.Capital.GetName] para adoptar el dios del sol. \nSegún la mayoría de los relatos, los sacerdotes extranjeros obligaron a que toda la gente reunida para la ceremonia entregase todas sus posesiones a la estatua dorada de su nuevo dios en una exhibición humillante.\nNi te imaginas a qué indignidades les habrán sometido los sacerdotes extranjeros, pero ya solo es cuestión de tiempo que esta nueva religión se abra paso en [Root.Capital.GetName].

column2: Crowned by Local Acolyte of the Church, themselves
Crowned by a Local Bishop of the Church, themselves
Crowned by the Shepard of the Church, themselves.
Crowned myself for I represent the authority vested to me by God.
Only the Pope is fit to crown me!
column3: Seul le Pope est apte à me couronner !
column4: Nur der Pope ist in der Lage, mich zu krönen!
column6: ¡Solo el Pope es digno de coronarme!

column2: Send for the most powerful Bishop in the realm!
column3: Faites venir le plus puissant évêque du pays !
column4: Bittet den mächtigsten Bischof im Reich!
column6: ¡Haced llamar al obispo más poderoso del reino!

column2:
To [Root.GetTitledName],
I shall be glad to legitimize your divine right to rule, as soon as you recognize that the Church is no servant to any King or Emperor, but instead watches over the salvation of the souls of all those in the faith, regardless of their stature. 

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] made good use of my money: the holy walls have been filled to the brim with wine and whores. Soon after the start of the celebration for my upcoming coronation, the crowd of lechers and drunks invited to the party are already debasing themselves in the most abominable acts imaginable.

I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The Pope blesses me before placing the Imperial Crown upon my head and proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape me bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur ma tête et de me proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete mich, während er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf mein Haupt zu legen und mich durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] zu krönen.
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa me bendice y me pone la corona imperial en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as a host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The Pope blesses me and places the Royal Crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape me bénit avant de placer la couronne royale sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete mich, legte die Krone auf mein Haupt und verkündete durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa me bendice y me pone la corona real en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as a host of vassals surrounds us in complete silence. The [coronation_priest.GetTitle] blesses me and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de vassaux nous entourent dans un silence complet. [coronation_priest.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] me bénit, place la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. [coronation_priest.GetDerDie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] segnete mich, setzte die Krone auf mein Haupt und verkündete durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] meine Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos nos rodea en un silencio absoluto. [coronation_priest.GetElLaCap] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bendice y me pone la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: I kneel before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] in the empty hall of my palace and, after a quick blessing, the [coronation_priest.GetTitle] summarily and places the crown upon my head, proclaiming me [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Je m'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] dans la grande salle vide de mon palais et, après une rapide bénédiction, [coronation_priest.Get_only_le_Title][coronation_priest.GetTitle] me bénit, place sommairement la couronne sur ma tête et me proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: Ich kniete in der leeren Halle meines Palastes vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] nieder und nach einem kurzen Segen setzte [coronation_priest.Getderdie] [coronation_priest.GetTitle] kurzerhand die Krone auf meinen Kopf und krönte mich durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
column6: Me arrodillo ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] en un salón vacío de palacio y tras una bendición rápida, el [coronation_priest.GetTitle] me pone precipitadamente la corona en la cabeza, proclamándome [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of Electors and vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The Pope blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] before placing the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName]'s head and proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of the Romans by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], and protector of all [GetChristendomOrRandom].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de princes électeurs et de vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur sa tête et de [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de tous les Romains par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod], et protecteur de toute la [GetChristendomOrRandom].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Kurfürsten und Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], bevor er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf das Haupt von [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] zu legen und durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] aller Römer und Beschützer aller [GetChristendomOrRandom]en Gläubigen zu machen.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos y electores les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa bendice a [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] antes de ponerle la corona imperial en la cabeza y proclamar[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de los romanos y protector de la Cristiandad por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The Pope blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] before placing the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName]'s head and proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de ses vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit avant de placer la couronne impériale sur sa tête et de [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclamer [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], während er sich darauf vorbereitete, die Kaiserkrone auf das Haupt von [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] zu legen und [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] zu krönen.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice antes de poner la corona imperial en la cabeza de [coronation_ruler.GetFirstName] y proclamar[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The Pope gives the child an encouraging smile as [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] and places the Imperial Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de ses vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape fait un sourire d'encouragement à l'enfant, [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit, place la couronne impériale sur sa tête et [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst schenkte dem Kind noch ein ermutigendes Lächeln, als [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] segnete, die Kaiserkrone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt legte und [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] verkündete.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa da al niño una sonrisa de ánimo mientras [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice y [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] pone la corona imperial en la cabeza, proclamándo[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The Pope blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] and places the Royal Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de ses vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit, place la couronne royale sur sa tête et [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst segnete [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie], legte die Krone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt und verkündete [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice y [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] pone la corona real en la cabeza, proclamándo[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kneels before [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] as [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] host of vassals surrounds them in complete silence. The Pope gives the child an encouraging smile as [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] blesses [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] and places the Royal Crown upon [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] head, proclaiming [coronation_ruler.GetHerHim] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] of [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] by grace of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: [coronation_ruler.Get_Le_TitledFirstName] s'agenouille devant [coronation_priest.Get_le_TitledFirstName] alors qu'une série de ses vassaux les entourent dans un silence complet. Le Pape fait un sourire d'encouragement à l'enfant, [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] bénit, place la couronne royale sur sa tête et [coronation_ruler.GetLeLa] proclame [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_Realm] par la grâce [Root.Get_du_HighGod].
column4: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] kniete vor [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName], während uns eine Schar [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]er Vasallen in völliger Stille umgab. Der Papst schenkte dem Kind noch ein ermutigendes Lächeln, als [coronation_priest.GetSheHe] [coronation_ruler.Getihnsie] segnete, die Krone auf [coronation_ruler.GetHerHis] Haupt legte und coronation_ruler.GetHerHis]e Krönung [coronation_ruler.Getzumzur] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] von [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] durch die Gnade von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] verkündete.
column6: [coronation_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] se arrodilla ante [coronation_priest.GetTitledFirstName] mientras una multitud de vasallos les rodea en un silencio absoluto. El papa da al niño una sonrisa de ánimo mientras [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] bendice y [coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] pone la corona real en la cabeza, proclamándo[coronation_ruler.GetRleRla] [coronation_ruler.GetTitle] de [coronation_ruler.PrimaryTitle.GetName] por la gracia de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

column2: [GetFromRelation]'s crown is amazing! [From.GetSheHeCap] says only the [From.GetTitle] can wear it, but I am [From.GetHerHis] [Root.GetSonDaughter], and is that not close enough?
column3: La couronne de m[From.GetOnA] [GetFromRelation] est merveilleuse ! [From.GetIlElleCap] dit que seul[Root.Get_E] [From.Get_only_le_Title][From.GetTitle] peut la porter, mais je suis s[Root.GetOnA] [Root.GetSonDaughter] alors c'est presque pareil...
column4: Die Krone m[From.Geteineseiner] [GetFromRelation] ist erstaunlich! [From.GetSheHeCap] sagt, dass sie nur [From.Geteineine] [From.GetTitle] tragen kann. Ich bin [From.GetHerHis][Root.GeteFemale] [Root.GetSonDaughter], reicht das nicht?
column6: ¡La corona de mi [GetFromRelation] es increíble! Y dice que solo la puede llevar [From.GetElLa] [From.GetTitle], pero soy su [Root.GetSonDaughter]. Eso está bastante cerca, ¿no?

column2: So shiny!
column3: Tellement brillante !
column4: So glänzend!
column6: ¡Cómo brilla!

column2: I was woken up this morning by disturbing news: a guard stormed in my bedchambers to warn me that my crown had been stolen. I was disconcerted to discover, only a few hours later, that my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] was the culprit. The foolish child is prancing around the Imperial gardens wearing the holy crown of Leonidas.
column3: J'ai été réveillé[Root.Get_E] ce matin par des nouvelles inquiétantes. Un garde s'est précipité dans ma chambre pour m'avertir que ma couronne a été volée. J'ai été déconcerté[Root.Get_E] de découvrir, quelques heures plus tard, que m[From.GetOnA] [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] était [From.GetLeLa] coupable. L'enfant caracole dans les jardins impériaux avec la sainte couronne de Leonidas.
column4: Beunruhigenden Nachrichten haben mich heute geweckt. Eine Wache stürmte in meine Schlafgemächer und warnte mich, dass meine Krone gestohlen wurde. Ich war bestürzt, als ich entdeckte, dass m[From.Geteineine] [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] [From.Getderdie] Schuldige war. Das dumme Kind tänzelnd im kaiserlichen Garten umher und trägt dabei die heilige Krone von Karl dem Großen.
column6: Esta mañana me despertaron unas noticias perturbadoras cuando un guardia irrumpió en mis aposentos para avisarme de que me habían robado la corona. Me desconcertó saber horas más tarde que el culpable era mi [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName]. Resulta que estaba brincando en los jardines imperiales con la sagrada corona de Carlomagno.

column2: I should teach [From.GetHerHim] about the sacred history of this crown.
column3: Je vais lui raconter l'histoire sacrée de cette couronne.
column4: Ich werde [From.GetHerHim] die heilige Geschichte dieser Krone beibringen.
column6: Tengo que enseñarle la historia sagrada de esta corona.

column2: Give me back the crown immediately, [From.GetSonDaughter]!
column3: Rendez-moi la couronne immédiatement, m[From.GetOnA] [From.GetSonDaughter] !
column4: Gib mir sofort meine Krone zurück, [From.GetSonDaughter]!
column6: ¡Devuélveme la corona de inmediato, [From.GetSonDaughter]!

column2: Eh, I will let the kid have [From.GetHerHis] fun...
column3: Je vais laisser l'enfant s'amuser...
column4: Das Kind soll [From.GetHerHis]en Spaß haben...
column6: Dejemos que [From.GetElLa] pobre se divierta…

column2: My [GetFromRelation] caught me! Fortunately, [From.GetSheHe] was not too upset that I had taken [From.GetHerHis] crown. Instead, [From.GetSheHe] took me aside and told me a long story about the ancient Kings the crown belonged to before getting to [From.GetHerHim].
column3: M[From.GetOnA] [GetFromRelation] m'a attrapé[Root.Get_E] ! Heureusement, [From.GetIlElle] n'était pas trop contrarié[From.Get_E] pour avoir pris sa couronne. [From.GetIlElleCap] m'a raconté une longue histoire sur les anciens rois auxquels la couronne a appartenu avant [From.GetLuiElle].
column4: M[From.Geteineine] [GetFromRelation] hat mich erwischt! Glücklicherweise war [From.GetSheHe] nicht verärgert, dass ich [From.GetHerHis]e Krone genommen hat. Stattdessen nahm [From.GetSheHe] mich beiseite und erzähle mir eine lange Geschichte über die alten Könige, denen die Krone gehörte, bevor [From.GetSheHe] sie selbst erhalten hat.
column6: ¡Mi [GetFromRelation] me pilló! Por suerte, no se enfadó demasiado por llevarme la corona. En su lugar, me llevo a un aparte y me contó una larga historia sobre los antiguos reyes a los que perteneció la corona antes que a [From.GetElElla].

column2: Oh...
column3: Oh...
column4: Oh...
column6: Oh…

column2: My [GetFromRelation] caught me! [From.GetSheHeCap] was really mad to discover that it was I who took [From.GetHerHis] crown. [From.GetSheHeCap] had me dragged back to my chambers and made me skip both lunch and dinner!
column3: M[From.GetOnA] [GetFromRelation] m'a attrapé[Root.Get_E] ! [From.GetIlElleCap] était furieu[From.GetXSe] de découvrir que c'était moi qui lui avais pris sa couronne. [From.GetIlElleCap] m'a traîné[Root.Get_E] dans mes appartements et privé[Root.Get_E] de déjeuner et de dîner !
column4: M[From.Geteineine] [GetFromRelation] hat mich erwischt! [From.GetSheHeCap] war wirklich sauer zu entdecken, dass ich [From.GetHerHis]e Krone genommen hatte. [From.GetSheHeCap] ließ mich in mein Zimmer bringen und sowohl Mittag- als auch Abendessen auslassen!
column6: ¡Mi [GetFromRelation] me pilló! Se enfadó muchísimo al descubrir que fui yo quien se llevó la corona. ¡Me llevó de vuelta a mis aposentos y me ha castigado sin comida ni cena!

column2: I am so sorry!
column3: Je suis vraiment désolé[Root.Get_E] !
column4: Es tut mir leid!
column6: ¡Lo siento mucho!

column2: The magnanimous [From.GetTitledName] has donated the island of [potential_title.GetBaseName] to the Knights of Peter Claver. As one of the long standing protectors of the faith, this will surely make the routes safer for all the pilgrims seeking the Holy Land. The order is now known as the Knights of [potential_title.GetBaseName], and [d_knights_hospitaler.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] vows to continue their mission as the righteous defenders of Christianity and its faithful followers.

To [Root.GetTitledName],
I will gladly recognize your divine right to rule, as soon as you return to the Conferantia some papal lands over which you are wrongly proclaiming ownership, a violation of a sacred agreement.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

To [Root.GetTitledName],
I will gladly recognize your divine right to rule, as soon as you return to the Cao Dai See some Viet lands over which you are wrongly proclaiming ownership, a violation of a sacred agreement.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

To [Root.GetTitledName],\nBefore I can recognize your divine right to rule, you must deliver back under Papal control some papal lands being currently withheld by a wicked ruler against Our wishes, a clear violation of a sacred agreement.

To [Root.GetTitledName],\nBefore I can recognize your divine right to rule, you must deliver back under Cao Dai See control some Viet lands being currently withheld by a wicked ruler against Our wishes, a clear violation of a sacred agreement.

The [christian.GetGroupName] Pope has decided to call one of his lackeys to arms against me, in an attempt to reclaim some of the papal lands currently under my control. [From.GetTitledName] has just declared war against me on the Pope's behalf.

The Papal State has decided to press some of its ancient claims over papal lands by enlisting the help of [From.GetTitledName]. If our armies are defeated in the coming war, we will all be forced to submit to the rule of the Supreme Pontiff.

The [cao_dai.GetName] Giao-Tong has decided to call one of his lackeys to arms against me, in an attempt to reclaim some of the Viet lands currently under my control. [From.GetTitledName] has just declared war against me on the Giao-Tong's behalf.

The Cao Dai See has decided to press some of its ancient claims over Viet lands by enlisting the help of [From.GetTitledName]. If our armies are defeated in the coming war, we will all be forced to submit to the rule of the Church.
The road forward is clear: I must press the Church's claim over [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and restore [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s lands to Cao Dai rule if I wish to be crowned [Root.GetTitle].

I have successfully wrestled Cao Dai lands from infidel control and delivered them back under the blessed authority of the Cao Dai See. Such an act has certainly ensured me a place in Heaven, or at the very least the gratitude of the Giao-Tong.

I have successfully wrestled Cao Dai lands from infidel control and delivered them back under the blessed authority of the Cao Dai See. Now that this war is over, it is finally time for me to receive my crown.

I have successfully wrestled Cao Dai lands from infidel control and delivered them back under the blessed authority of the Cao Dai See. His Holiness was so relieved by my victory that he decided to entrust me with the safekeeping of one of the most sacred relics of the Church.

I have successfully wrestled Cao Dai lands from infidel control and delivered them back under the blessed authority of the Cao Dai See. His Holiness was so relieved by my victory that he has not only decided to keep his promise to crown me, but also has entrusted me with the safekeeping of one of the most sacred relics of the Church.

To [Root.GetTitledName],
Your request is frankly ludicrous. We were vested authority to oversee the flocks of Asia by virtue of the absence of the Pope in Rome. If you wish to have a crown, I urge you to openly submit to the Papacy.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

To [Root.GetTitledName],
Your request is frankly ludicrous. The Shining Lord gave full control of Vietnam to the Cao Dai See in his last will and testament. If you wish to have a crown, I urge you to openly submit to the Cao Dai See.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
Demands Land

As such is the will of the Conferantia, I decided to formally submit myself and my Empire to the sacred authority of the Universal Church. From now and forever more, His Holiness [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and His successors will have control over our lands, as it was intended by Our Lady of La Vang when she appeared in La Vang.

As such is the will of the Cao Dai See, I decided to formally submit myself and my Empire to the sacred authority of the Universal Church. From now and forever more, His Holiness [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and His successors will have control over our lands, as it was intended by the last will and testament of The Shining Lord.

The Cao Dai See has seen fit to press its ancient claim over my lands, and, in [From.GetHerHis] wisdom, my liege has decided to grant him his request. As such, it appears I have now become a vassal of the Cao Dai See.
